16.53.text:
Welcome back!
And great work again from all of you

19.84.text:
who completed the
Astro Coding Mission.

22.84.text:
That was a tough one
but, we hope, also fun.

31.20.text: And remember if any of you need any help

33.23.text:
completing your badges just ask your Team
Leader

35.50.text: or contact Head of Cadet Training

37.26.text: Dr Alice Kuiper through her profile on Makewaves.

48.57.text: some of the most outstanding work

49.93.text: from previous Missions at the UNSA homepage

52.10.text: so, head over there to see if your team

54.36.text: is in our top picks this week.

67.02.text:
So, this week's Mission has been made with
our partners

71.25.text:
at the British Science Association
and it's all about Living in Space.

87.60.text: So, very soon our patron, Tim Peake

91.17.text:
is going to be launching to the
International Space Station.

95.14.text:
He's been training for this Mission for nearly
five years

98.63.text:
so that he can live in a very different environment
to the one that we're all used to on Earth.

104.30.text:
There's only a very small amount of gravity
on the space station so everything floats

109.63.text: and because he'll be travelling around the Earth

115.01.text: he'll experience 16 sunrises and sunsets every day!

122.78.text: I wonder how Mini Jon would feel about that?

126.54.text:
So, err... in this Mission, we're inviting you
to

130.36.text:
find out more about what it's like to live
on the International Space Station

134.46.text:
and to be as creative as possible
in your responses.

138.61.text:
This Mission is now live on Makewaves
so you can get started on it straight away.

146.56.text: Hey hey! Agent Ruari, I was beginning to worry

149.37.text: there about you not interrupting me.

151.44.text: Have you brought me a biscuit?

155.55.text: Dr Kuiper told me to give you this.

163.78.text: He left a message on his profile

173.30.text:
I'm really sorry to do this but I'm quitting
my training

177.33.text:
I'm rubbish at science and exams
and I could only get the badges with

180.77.text: loads of help from all the other Cadets.

183.68.text: It was stupid of me to think

185.11.text: I could ever get to space and be an astronaut.

189.64.text: I mean what's the point of going to space anyway?

193.44.text: I'm sorry to let you all down.

195.44.text:
I hope you'll find someone else to be
UNSA's first astronaut.

199.44.text:
Don't worry about me, I'm staying somewhere
safe.

203.04.text: Thanks for helping me before and sorry again,

214.04.text: I don't know. Um, I mean maybe he's right...

217.29.text:
Maybe we're being unrealistic.
I mean it is really difficult to get to space.

227.84.text: I mean, compared to almost anything else in the Universe

233.66.text: Well I think we should keep trying.

235.38.text: Just because we're small, doesn't mean we

237.23.text: can't keep working hard and follow our dreams

239.77.text:
however ambitious they are,
or ridiculous they might seem to anyone else.

243.60.text: But what's the point, all we've got is a shed.

246.25.text:
It's our Headquarters!
And it's cool.

249.20.text:
There's loads of other people who still want
to do this.

251.61.text: The Cadets have been doing some amazing work.

253.55.text: I bet they could help persuade Mini Jon to come back.

258.19.text:
I bet when Tim found the training hard
he didn't give up.

261.25.text:
I bet all his friends and family kept on
supporting him to keep going.

267.54.text: You're right Agent Ruari, of course you are.

271.26.text: You should all keep going with your Missions

275.60.text: We can all still do this.

293.12.text:
and think you'd make an
amazing astronaut

302.98.text: I'm just writing to Mini Jon.

306.47.text:
Ok, well look, I'll be in in 5 minutes to
make tea, ok.

311.52.text: Please write back and let me know you're ok
